title: Destruction and Persistence of Sacred Objects and Sites in East Timor

questions.question: What was the initial approach of Portuguese missionaries towards indigenous sacred objects in East Timor?
questions.answer: Destruction and replacement

questions.question: Which term best describes the combining of different religious or cultural beliefs and practices?
questions.answer: Syncretism

questions.question: What was a common strategy used by East Timorese communities to protect sacred objects during colonial periods?
questions.answer: Concealment

questions.question: During the Indonesian occupation, what was one of the pressures placed on East Timorese religious practices?
choices: Pressure to convert to recognized religions
questions.answer: Pressure to convert to recognized religions

questions.question: What is the term for the act of treating a sacred place or object with violent disrespect?
questions.answer: Desecration

questions.question: What is an uma lulik in East Timorese culture?
questions.answer: A sacred house

questions.question: How did some East Timorese communities adapt their rituals when traditional sacred sites became inaccessible?
choices: They conducted ceremonies in private homes or nature
They sought permission from colonial authorities
questions.answer: They conducted ceremonies in private homes or nature

questions.question: What was one way East Timorese people incorporated Catholic elements into their indigenous practices?
choices: Blending Catholic and indigenous elements in rituals
Separating Catholic and indigenous practices strictly
questions.answer: Blending Catholic and indigenous elements in rituals

questions.question: What is the significance of the sacred spring of Be Matan Ruak?
choices: It's a source of drinking water for the capital city
It's a site for purification and healing rituals
It's where the first Portuguese missionaries landed
It's the location of the largest uma lulik
questions.answer: It's a site for purification and healing rituals

questions.question: How did the Indonesian occupation affect access to sacred sites in East Timor?
choices: It improved access for all citizens
It had no effect on access
It restricted access due to military operations
It encouraged international tourism to sacred sites
questions.answer: It restricted access due to military operations

questions.question: What is one challenge faced in preserving sacred sites in East Timor post-independence?
choices: Lack of interest from local communities
questions.answer: Balancing preservation with tourism development

questions.question: What role do sacred objects and sites play in East Timorese communities?
choices: They are important only for tourism
They play a central role in social cohesion and identity
They are irrelevant in modern society
questions.answer: They play a central role in social cohesion and identity

questions.question: How did some East Timorese communities preserve their spiritual traditions during the colonial period?
choices: By adapting and incorporating Catholic elements
By isolating themselves from all outside contact
questions.answer: By adapting and incorporating Catholic elements

questions.question: What is iconoclasm in the context of this module?
choices: The destruction of religious images or sacred objects
questions.answer: The destruction of religious images or sacred objects

questions.question: How did the Indonesian government's policies affect traditional East Timorese practices?
choices: They promoted and preserved all traditional practices
They had no impact on traditional practices
They often conflicted with and discouraged traditional practices
questions.answer: They often conflicted with and discouraged traditional practices

questions.question: What is one way sacred traditions have been revived in post-independence East Timor?
choices: Through the rebuilding of uma lulik
By making traditional practices mandatory for all citizens
Through the destruction of Catholic churches
questions.answer: Through the rebuilding of uma lulik

questions.question: What does the persistence of sacred traditions in East Timor demonstrate?
choices: The superiority of indigenous beliefs over foreign ones
questions.answer: The resilience of cultural traditions

questions.question: How has the younger generation in East Timor responded to traditional practices post-independence?
questions.answer: With renewed interest

questions.question: What is one way the East Timorese maintained their sacred narratives during colonial periods?
questions.answer: Through storytelling

questions.question: How did the forced relocation during the Indonesian occupation affect East Timorese spiritual practices?
choices: It enhanced connection to sacred sites
It disrupted connection to sacred sites
It led to the creation of new sacred sites
questions.answer: It disrupted connection to sacred sites

questions.question: What is one way syncretism manifested in East Timorese spiritual practices?
choices: Complete rejection of all traditional elements
Adoption of some indigenous symbols into Catholic iconography
Strict separation of Catholic and indigenous practices
Conversion of all Catholic churches into traditional sacred sites
questions.answer: Adoption of some indigenous symbols into Catholic iconography

questions.question: What role did the Catholic Church play in East Timor's independence movement?
choices: It played a significant supportive role
questions.answer: It played a significant supportive role

questions.question: How has the concept of lulik evolved in modern East Timor?
choices: It remains exactly as it was in pre-colonial times
It has adapted while maintaining cultural significance
It is only practiced by the elderly
questions.answer: It has adapted while maintaining cultural significance

questions.question: What is one challenge in balancing tradition and modernity in East Timorese spiritual practices?
choices: Lack of interest from any age group
Universal agreement on how to proceed
questions.answer: Negotiating between preservation and development

questions.question: How did the Portuguese colonial approach to indigenous sacred objects change over time?
choices: It shifted from destruction to syncretism and incorporation
It became more restrictive over time
It had no change throughout the colonial period
questions.answer: It shifted from destruction to syncretism and incorporation

questions.question: What is one way East Timorese communities have involved younger generations in preserving sacred traditions?
choices: Through educational programs about site importance
By keeping all traditional knowledge secret
By replacing traditional practices with modern alternatives
questions.answer: Through educational programs about site importance

questions.question: How has tourism affected sacred sites in East Timor?
choices: It has only positively affected preservation efforts
It has created challenges in balancing preservation and development
It has led to the closure of all sacred sites
questions.answer: It has created challenges in balancing preservation and development

questions.question: What is one way the East Timorese have used art to maintain their sacred traditions?

By only producing art for foreign markets
Through the destruction of all traditional art forms

questions.question: How have East Timorese communities integrated traditional knowledge with conservation efforts?
choices: By only using modern conservation techniques
Through combining traditional and modern approaches
By leaving conservation entirely to foreign experts
questions.answer: Through combining traditional and modern approaches

questions.question: What role do elders play in preserving sacred traditions in East Timor?
choices: They have no role in modern practices
They often perform traditional blessings alongside modern rituals
